subject: Personal Finance
title: Fiscal vs Monetary Policy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Fiscal vs Monetary Policy.

hook.text: When COVID hit, Congress sent $1,200 checks. The Fed slashed rates to zero. Same goal, different tools.

buildup.text: Fiscal policy is government spending and taxation. Monetary policy is central bank interest rate control.

discovery.text: Fiscal policy directly puts money in hands. Monetary policy works indirectly through borrowing costs.

twist.text: They can conflict. Governments spend big while central banks try to cool the economy by raising rates.

climax.text: The balance between fiscal and monetary policy shapes inflation, employment, and growth for years.

punchline.text: Two levers, one economy, constant tension.

quiz.question: What is the difference between fiscal and monetary policy?
options: Fiscal is spending and taxes; monetary is interest rates
Fiscal policy is set by the central bank
